title: O'Neil Theatres Inc.
content:
[http://www.movie-info.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050642/http:/www.movie-info.com/ "http://www.movie-info.com/")

It isn’t Santa Fe... thoughts?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050642im_/http:/typophile.com/files/oneil_5943.jpg)

 [‹ Space Collective Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050642/http:/typophile.com/node/42551 "Go to previous forum topic") [2004 Business card font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050642/http:/typophile.com/node/42548 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Miss Tiffany

comments.content:
[Harlow Solid](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014050642/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/harlow_solid/?sample_text=O'Neil%20Theatres%20lnc.) kerned tightly, with a modified ’T’, and using a lower case ’L’ for the ’I’ in “Inc.”

- Lex

And a star for the tittle.

- Lex

Harlow!! See I kept think Bridgit Bardot for some reason. I knew the name had an actress reference.

Thanks!!
